text:
<https://articles.edhrec.com/underdogs-corner-multani-yavimayas-avatar/>
<@U3FV90TCZ> is up
If we could all read the article and, if you think of something good, make a comment on the articles from now on, I would appreciate it. Seeing a lot of commenta will encourage readers to comment
got it, make 100 fake accounts that all say "great job ~insert author here~"
I would prefer that the 100 fake accounts didn't all say the same thing
NO COLLUSION
well now you're making it hard
Perhaps we could talk to the Russian EDH counterparts to make some bots for us…
Does anyone else kinda miss the Dear Azami mailbag articles SCG used to do for commander?
YES
That’s the only series of theirs I read for a long time.
I still don't understand why we don't have a mailbag column
And/or a Dear Abbey type column
Is that even a thing people would read?
… :raised_hand:
Since I can't get folks to suggest many other 60 card decks I've been wondering if that was something I should start asking for as well
I 100% would.
<@U286Q175Y> <@U32LRG9NU> what do you guys think? You see the numbers, would it be worth it switching to a mailbox column instead?
Also, how much mail do we get? You could solicit letters on Twitter in advance.
Yea, I’m going to do that mardu nonsense for sure but if there’s interest I’d make some announcement to send in their decks to get started
<@U286Q175Y> do you think CK would sponsor the column too the way SCG did for theirs? Whoever I pick from the mailbag gets a $10 store credit or something minimal
I think these ideas all have potential
Already had 2 responses via twattor saying they like the idea
$10 store credit is piddling to a retailer like CK. Send them an email and see. I bet they would.
<https://twitter.com/EDHRECast/status/1016419097637244930>

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/EDHRECast|@EDHRECast>: So who out there would be interested in reading a "Dear Abbey" style mailbag column over at <https://twitter.com/edhrec|@edhrec>? Submit your decklists, ask for some help, get a reworked/updated decklist back. We'd love to hear your ideas!
attachments.text: So who out there would be interested in reading a "Dear Abbey" style mailbag column over at <https://twitter.com/edhrec|@edhrec>? Submit your decklists, ask for some help, get a reworked/updated decklist back. We'd love to hear your ideas!

text: Would it just be decklists? Reworking decklists is a very large ordeal. I'm wondering if getting people to ask about a specific problem might be better. You could do a couple of short paragraphs reworking a specific package or something in a deck rather than rebuilding the whole thing.
Unless that's your bag and you really like rebuilding decks.
Also, that would let you address a couple of different readers/decks in a column.
The Azami series was pretty loose
Yea, it would probably be fairly loose
Or that
People could request themes, total work ups or even just suggest the theme they wanted with a few cards
(Not saying that's how it has to be done, but my point is flexibility made it easier to do different things and keep readers engaged)
That's how my daily EDH tweets have been. Pretty flexible and loose.
It's interesting. I just keep posting and more people keep commenting and following me.
Maybe someday I'll be a big star! :star::sunglasses::star:
I've been trying to watch for them each day to reply and RT :stuck_out_tongue:
(I mean, I try to RT most of ya'lls stuff when I see it)
That's a lie
You called us butt nuggets. That's a far cry from RT'ing us
I'd likely hire externally and I don't know how to figure out who would be good at writing a series like that
Yeah, I've noticed. Thanks, I appreciate it
Henry would, Jason. Let Henry crush the dreams of the children.
It wouldn't be so much a mailbag column then as it would be a "why your deck sucks. Part 1" column
With annotated footnotes.
2,500 words later he's on to the 99
If Henry had time, he wouldn't have stopped being our editor for way more money than he'd get paid to write a column
A mailbag thing could be fun. I think many people that play edh are comfortable with deckbuildong, but editing and tuning is definitely a skill that people are interested in
Very true.
Teach people to fish and all that
The Dear Azami articles were actually the thing that got me first interested in EDH
Or, one of the first things
Could turn it into a teaching tool for the site too.
“Well if you like this card, from the page you’ll see...”

I’ll be honest that i didnt fully read the convo and i need to head out, just wanted to provide a response. sorry if im out of touch

In the question about “sponsorship” here are my general thoughts on the subject for the future:
 - I generally prefer to keep things simple and reduce my strings tied to others — companies or patreons or people or wahtever — if you want $$ try to work it out for me and i’ll pay for it if there is value to be had
 - If you want “CK to sponsor” something, i can just do that inside of my current relationship. I can tag the source and then we can piece it out later
People seem to know what they want to add, but cutting....ew. Far less fun haha
Cutting is the bane of my existence
It's easier to make cuts when it's not your deck
Give me 120 cards I'll give you a 74 card deck
Of course.
Perfect for the kitchen table anti-mill tech
I always chant the writer's mantra "kill your darlings" when I move into cuts mode.
<@U32LRG9NU> we got an external volunteer!
<https://twitter.com/norbert88/status/1016430278523457536>

attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/norbert88|@norbert88>: <https://twitter.com/EDHRECast|@EDHRECast> <https://twitter.com/edhrec|@edhrec> If you need someone to review and rework decklists, I am available :relaxed:
attachments.text: <https://twitter.com/EDHRECast|@EDHRECast> <https://twitter.com/edhrec|@edhrec> If you need someone to review and rework decklists, I am available :relaxed:

text: one thing that i struggle with is who is a good deckbuilder in EDH
like all of you all could be the worst fing magic players of all time, and probably are
Fight me in real life, bro.
i think for EDH, a mailbag deckbuilder thing would have to have a spin to it
I blame <@U33EGB4TX>
like “help me make my deck more competitive” “help me make my deck more fun” “help me make my deck 75%”
"Help me play more Rishkar's Expertise"
like if anyone wants to make their deck meaner let me know
thats my expertise
or if it was made into a collaborative thing, each person could represent a different voice
like one person could always be pinned at making the deck less shitty/more competitive, one person could be more thematic, one person could be politically / fun conscious
Do we really need to give <@U3RJ9VDRT> any more voice than he already has?
Who?
Moooooooooooooore me? Okdoke
<@U3MTJRAQL> SUBMISSION HAS BEEN SUBMITTED, GOOD SIR!
